verses.kjv: Now it came to pass after this, that Nahash the king of the children of Ammon died, and his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: After this, Nahash the king of the children of Ammon died, and his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: Some time later, Nahash the king of Ammon died, and his son became king after him.

verses.kjv: And David said, I will shew kindness unto Hanun the son of Nahash, because his father shewed kindness to me. And David sent messengers to comfort him concerning his father. So the servants of David came into the land of the children of Ammon to Hanun, to comfort him.
verses.web: David said, “I will show kindness to Hanun the son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me.” So David sent messengers to comfort him concerning his father. David’s servants came into the land of the children of Ammon to Hanun, to comfort him.
verses.ct: David said, "I want to show kindness to Hanun son of Nahash, because his father was kind to me." So David sent messengers to express his sympathy over his father's death. But when David's servants arrived in the land of Ammon to comfort Hanun,

verses.kjv: But the princes of the children of Ammon said to Hanun, Thinkest thou that David doth honour thy father, that he hath sent comforters unto thee? are not his servants come unto thee for to search, and to overthrow, and to spy out the land?
verses.web: But the princes of the children of Ammon said to Hanun, “Do you think that David honors your father, in that he has sent comforters to you? Haven’t his servants come to you to search, to overthrow, and to spy out the land?”
verses.ct: the Ammonite leaders said to Hanun, "Do you really think David is honoring your father by sending men to comfort you? They're here to scout the land, gather intelligence, and plan an invasion!"

verses.kjv: Wherefore Hanun took David’s servants, and shaved them, and cut off their garments in the midst hard by their buttocks, and sent them away.
verses.web: So Hanun took David’s servants, shaved them, and cut off their garments in the middle at their buttocks, and sent them away.
verses.ct: So Hanun seized David's servants, shaved off their beards, cut their robes off at the waist to expose their buttocks, and sent them away humiliated.

verses.kjv: Then there went certain, and told David how the men were served. And he sent to meet them: for the men were greatly ashamed. And the king said, Tarry at Jericho until your beards be grown, and then return.
verses.web: Then some people went and told David how the men were treated. He sent to meet them; for the men were greatly humiliated. The king said, “Stay at Jericho until your beards have grown, and then return.”
verses.ct: When David learned how his men had been treated, he sent someone to meet them on the road, because they were deeply ashamed. The king told them, "Stay in Jericho until your beards grow back, and then come home."

verses.kjv: And when the children of Ammon saw that they had made themselves odious to David, Hanun and the children of Ammon sent a thousand talents of silver to hire them chariots and horsemen out of Mesopotamia, and out of Syriamaachah, and out of Zobah.
verses.web: When the children of Ammon saw that they had made themselves odious to David, Hanun and the children of Ammon sent one thousand talents of silver to hire chariots and horsemen out of Mesopotamia, out of Aram-maacah, and out of Zobah.
verses.ct: The Ammonites realized they had made an enemy of David, so Hanun and the Ammonites sent 1,000 talents of silver to hire chariots and horsemen from Mesopotamia, Aram-maacah, and Zobah.

verses.kjv: So they hired thirty and two thousand chariots, and the king of Maachah and his people; who came and pitched before Medeba. And the children of Ammon gathered themselves together from their cities, and came to battle.
verses.web: So they hired for themselves thirty-two thousand chariots, and the king of Maacah with his people, who came and encamped near Medeba. The children of Ammon gathered themselves together from their cities, and came to battle.
verses.ct: They hired 32,000 chariots along with the king of Maacah and his forces, who came and set up camp near Medeba. The Ammonites also assembled their own troops from their cities and marched out for war.

verses.kjv: And when David heard of it, he sent Joab, and all the host of the mighty men.
verses.web: When David heard of it, he sent Joab with all the army of the mighty men.
verses.ct: When David heard about this, he sent Joab out with the entire army of Israel's best warriors.

verses.kjv: And the children of Ammon came out, and put the battle in array before the gate of the city: and the kings that were come were by themselves in the field.
verses.web: The children of Ammon came out, and put the battle in array at the gate of the city; and the kings who had come were by themselves in the field.
verses.ct: The Ammonites came out and formed their battle lines at the entrance to the city, while the kings who had come as allies took up separate positions in the open field.

verses.kjv: Now when Joab saw that the battle was set against him before and behind, he chose out of all the choice of Israel, and put them in array against the Syrians.
verses.web: Now when Joab saw that the battle was set against him before and behind, he chose some of all the choice men of Israel, and put them in array against the Syrians.
verses.ct: Joab saw that he was caught between two enemy forces — one in front and one behind. So he picked the best soldiers in Israel and lined them up to face the Syrians.

verses.kjv: And the rest of the people he delivered unto the hand of Abishai his brother, and they set themselves in array against the children of Ammon.
verses.web: The rest of the people he committed into the hand of Abishai his brother; and they put themselves in array against the children of Ammon.
verses.ct: He placed the rest of the troops under the command of his brother Abishai, and they formed up to face the Ammonites.

verses.kjv: And he said, If the Syrians be too strong for me, then thou shalt help me: but if the children of Ammon be too strong for thee, then I will help thee.
verses.web: He said, “If the Syrians are too strong for me, then you are to help me; but if the children of Ammon are too strong for you, then I will help you.
verses.ct: Joab told Abishai, "If the Syrians are too strong for me, come and help me. If the Ammonites are too strong for you, I'll come and help you.

verses.kjv: Be of good courage, and let us behave ourselves valiantly for our people, and for the cities of our God: and let the LORD do that which is good in his sight.
verses.web: Be courageous, and let’s be strong for our people and for the cities of our God. May LORD do that which seems good to him.”
verses.ct: Be brave! Let's fight with everything we have for our people and for the cities of our God. And may the LORD do what he sees as right."

verses.kjv: So Joab and the people that were with him drew nigh before the Syrians unto the battle; and they fled before him.
verses.web: So Joab and the people who were with him came near to the front of the Syrians to the battle; and they fled before him.
verses.ct: Joab and his men advanced against the Syrians, and the Syrians broke and ran.

verses.kjv: And when the children of Ammon saw that the Syrians were fled, they likewise fled before Abishai his brother, and entered into the city. Then Joab came to Jerusalem.
verses.web: When the children of Ammon saw that the Syrians had fled, they likewise fled before Abishai his brother, and entered into the city. Then Joab came to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: When the Ammonites saw that the Syrians had fled, they also retreated from Abishai and pulled back inside the city. After that, Joab returned to Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And when the Syrians saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they sent messengers, and drew forth the Syrians that were beyond the river: and Shophach the captain of the host of Hadarezer went before them.
verses.web: When the Syrians saw that they were defeated by Israel, they sent messengers, and called out the Syrians who were beyond the River, with Shophach the captain of the army of Hadadezer leading them.
verses.ct: When the Syrians realized they had been defeated by Israel, they sent messengers to call for reinforcements — Syrian forces from beyond the Euphrates River. Shophach, the commander of Hadarezer's army, led them.

verses.kjv: And it was told David; and he gathered all Israel, and passed over Jordan, and came upon them, and set the battle in array against them. So when David had put the battle in array against the Syrians, they fought with him.
verses.web: David was told that; so he gathered all Israel together, passed over the Jordan, came to them, and set the battle in array against them. So when David had put the battle in array against the Syrians, they fought with him.
verses.ct: When David got word of this, he assembled all of Israel's forces, crossed the Jordan River, and advanced against them. He drew up his battle lines facing the Syrians, and they engaged him in combat.

verses.kjv: But the Syrians fled before Israel; and David slew of the Syrians seven thousand men which fought in chariots, and forty thousand footmen, and killed Shophach the captain of the host.
verses.web: The Syrians fled before Israel; and David killed of the Syrian men seven thousand chariots, and forty thousand footmen, and also killed Shophach the captain of the army.
verses.ct: But the Syrians fled before Israel. David's forces killed 7,000 Syrian charioteers and 40,000 foot soldiers, and David also killed Shophach, the commander of their army.

verses.kjv: And when the servants of Hadarezer saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they made peace with David, and became his servants: neither would the Syrians help the children of Ammon any more.
verses.web: When the servants of Hadadezer saw that they were defeated by Israel, they made peace with David, and served him. The Syrians would not help the children of Ammon any more.
verses.ct: When Hadarezer's allies saw that Israel had defeated them, they made peace with David and submitted to his authority. From that point on, the Syrians refused to help the Ammonites ever again.
